headline.main: JAPANESE HARD HIT IN BURMA FIGHTING; British and Indians Hold Up Invaders' Units in New Drive for Border ENEMY'S LOSSES ARE HIGH Defenders Suffer Only Moderate Casualties in 10 Days of Combat in River Valley

lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI, India, June 1 (U.P.) British and Indian troops have inflicted considerable casualties on the Japanese in a series of localized engagements during the past ten days, with enemy units attempting to drive toward the Indian border from the Myittha Valley area of Western Burma, a British communique disclosed today.
abstract: Brit-Indian troops inflict heavy losses in checking Jap drive from Kalemyo to Tiddim; RAF raids Jap positions between Kalemyo and Ft White and in Buthidaung area; US planes raid Mandalay, central Burma rrs, and Jap installations, Sumprabum and Shingban
